Okay ACTUALLY ON TOPIC: so this game is interesting, it could be alot better, it looked cool, started off cool, until I played it, the graphics were on high when I started, should be nice and easy for my system, but nope, the game lagged a bit, the lag between hitting the button to turn and the actual car realizing you pressed the turn button is about a good 2-3 second difference, which makes this game a serious pain in the ass, holding the turn button is even worse because your car will just spin out.

My solution to low fps problem.
In msconfig set cpu (q6600 in my case) to 2 cores. Reboot, run game and instant profit.
Before - 33-37fps, 720p, lowest settings. Laggy.
After - 30fps, 1080p, maxed out. Awesome.
I disabled ambient occlusion, fxaa, motion blur and get 60 fps with everything else at max.

I am having problems using gamepad, axes work fine but not buttons. As soon as game launches, I hear a USB disconnection/reconnection sound, after that, gamepad won't work properly even after exit game, have to disconnect and reconnect it. Any suggestion?

after installation i got an error saying " the program cant start because MSVCP100.dll is missing "
.This file is actually concerned with microsoft visual c++ redistrubution package 2010...so I even installed it .....but game is still showing same message.....anybody help.......

FOR XP USERS
Step 1: Go to your System32 Folder (C:WINDOWSsystem32)
Step 2: Copy that user32.dll into the (GamepiresGas Guzzlers Combat CarnageBin32)
Step 3: Rename the user32.dll to dwmapi.dll
Works perfect, thanks... although i must suck, even on easy i can rarely qualify, lol.

This game is awesome!!!!!!! The handling is really good, kind of reminds me of how cars handled in Driver San Francisco which war also a very good driving game.

This is sort of like that old'school Marion Karts on N64, except the matured version. Extremely fun game and highly recommended.

Torrent works perfectly.

Thanks much sir...

If anyone gets the error "the program can't start because MSVCP100.dll is missing" and you first try to install Microsoft visual c++ redistrubution package 2010, then it still fails, you need the x86 version.  I made the mistake (I have Win7 x64) of installing the 64 bit version of Microsoft Visual C++ Redistribution Package but this game needs the 32 bit version (x86).

OK i had same problem but its actually simple you need to become number 1 in the rankings then race in the 3 round tournement after that go to your garage there will be a new car once you jump in that you will be in a new set of rankings races and weaponry

@JK425 Thanks for the heads up man. The game gets exponentially better with explosive guns and kewl cars. 

But the problem of car blowing up for no reason in 'knockout' is still persistent. :|
The reason your car is blowing up suddenly is because you are in a knockout race. Whenever you come in last in a round you are 'knocked out', hence the kablooey.

It works, until I get a strange camera angle + car spinning + other unwanted artifacts from start, I heart the whistle for go and the engines starting but the graphics are all screwed. So I restarted the game, fixed it. I had this occur about 15-20 times before reaching the second grand tournament (tier 2) - it's just stuck on spinning cars on blue sky.

I do consider buying this game, though. It must be a lot of fun in multiplayer!

Anyway, where the hell can you buy this game? Except GameStop? I mean ... I tried Google, but it's almost impossible to find any outlets.
Even Gamepires have dead links (Origin does not sell this game ... anymore?)
UPDATE: It was bad map files. I re-installed the game (and even patched to 1.1, doesn't need crack) and now everything works fine again.

This game rocks! I'm in late tier 2 (out of 3, as far as I could tell), cause I restarted the campaign twice. I had to try how hard hard could be - and I'm still winning races!

I'm old enough to remember Death Rally (en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Death_Rally), and few games of the kind have since given me the same euphoric experience. NFS came close with police chases. Destruction Derby for the PS1 comes to mind, as well. Honestly, this game gets a 10/10 from me, and I'm most probably going to buy and go online when I finish the campaign on hard. It's only about $20.

I bought the game and I can only hope you do the same. This awesome racing experience has been developed over the course of 13 months by a team of only 8 Croatian guys! Compared to the 200 employees that made Gran Turismo in two years, that's an accomplishment - especially as this is their first retail publishing.
Anyway, the game rocks, although there are a few lag issues in multiplayer which are being corrected as we speak. A multiplayer profile will be added to 1.2 with cars and upgrades for the online part.
Seriously, no matter what you do, upgrade the damn game! There's no copy protection, at all!
